intro: Succisa sabauda, commonly known as the Sabauda bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Succisa sabauda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
